info.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study Following Intravenous Administration of HF1K16 in Healthy Subjects to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of HF1K16

inclusion_lines.line: 2. Postmenopausal, defined as the following:

criterions.exact_snippets: Postmenopausal

inclusion_lines.line: 1. Surgically sterile for at least 3 months prior to screening by one of the following means:

criterions.exact_snippets: Surgically sterile for at least 3 months prior to screening

inclusion_lines.line: 7. Considered healthy by the Investigator, based on subject's reported medical history, full physical examination, 12-lead ECG, and vital signs;

Considered healthy by the Investigator, based on ... full physical examination

inclusion_lines.line: 3. Body mass index (BMI) of 18.0 to 32.0 kg/m2 inclusive and body weight not less than 50 kg;

body weight not less than 50 kg

inclusion_lines.line: 2. Between the ages of 18 and 55 years, inclusive;

criterions.exact_snippets: Between the ages of 18 and 55 years, inclusive

inclusion_lines.line: 1. Capable of giving informed consent and complying with study procedures;

criterions.exact_snippets: Capable of giving informed consent
complying with study procedures

inclusion_lines.line: 10. Willing and able to adhere to study restrictions and to be confined at the Clinical Research Unit

criterions.exact_snippets: Willing and able to adhere to study restrictions
Willing and able ... to be confined at the Clinical Research Unit
criterions.criterion: confinement at the Clinical Research Unit

inclusion_lines.line: Healthy volunteers allowed

criterions.exact_snippets: Healthy volunteers allowed

inclusion_lines.line: Must have maximum age of 55 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: maximum age of 55 Years

inclusion_lines.line: 9. Non-smoker and has not been exposed to any products containing nicotine in the last 6 months;

criterions.exact_snippets: Non-smoker
has not been exposed to any products containing nicotine in the last 6 months

inclusion_lines.line: 6. Male subjects must agree to utilize a highly effective method of contraception (condom plus spermicide) during heterosexual intercourse from the time of clinic admission until 12 weeks following the end of study visit, and refrain from donating sperm for this same period;

criterions.exact_snippets: Male subjects must agree to utilize a highly effective method of contraception (condom plus spermicide) during heterosexual intercourse from the time of clinic admission until 12 weeks following the end of study visit

comparisons.unit: weeks after end of study visit

criterions.exact_snippets: refrain from donating sperm for this same period

comparisons.unit: weeks after end of study visit

inclusion_lines.line: 8. Have clinical laboratory renal (eGFR, creatinine) and liver (AST, ALT, Total bilirubin) function within normal range and other clinical laboratory results within normal range or outside normal range assessed as clinically non-significant by the Investigator at screening and admission;

criterions.exact_snippets: clinical laboratory renal (eGFR, creatinine) ... within normal range
liver (AST, ALT, Total bilirubin) function within normal range
other clinical laboratory results within normal range or outside normal range assessed as clinically non-significant by the Investigator

expected_value: outside normal range assessed as clinically non-significant by the Investigator

inclusion_lines.line: * Bilateral salpingectomy (with or without oophorectomy)

criterions.exact_snippets: Bilateral salpingectomy (with or without oophorectomy)
with or without oophorectomy

inclusion_lines.line: 4. Female subjects must have a negative pregnancy test result at screening and at admission;

criterions.exact_snippets: Female subjects
negative pregnancy test result at screening
negative pregnancy test result ... at admission

inclusion_lines.line: * Bilateral oophorectomy (with or without hysterectomy)

criterions.exact_snippets: Bilateral oophorectomy (with or without hysterectomy)
(with or without hysterectomy)

inclusion_lines.line: * Postmenopausal status confirmed by serum follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and estradiol levels at screening;

criterions.exact_snippets: Postmenopausal status confirmed by serum follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and estradiol levels at screening

exclusion_lines.line: 12. Taken any prescription or non-prescription drugs and herbal medication known to be CYP450 inducers, inhibitors, and substrates within 14 days prior to screening (See Appendix B);

criterions.exact_snippets: Taken any prescription or non-prescription drugs and herbal medication known to be CYP450 inducers, inhibitors, and substrates within 14 days prior to screening
criterions.criterion: use of CYP450 inducers, inhibitors, and substrates

exclusion_lines.line: 11. Taken any prescription medications within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) of the first dose of study drug;

criterions.exact_snippets: Taken any prescription medications within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) of the first dose of study drug

exclusion_lines.line: 5. Reported family history of long QTc syndrome or a QTc of > 450 ms at screening;

criterions.exact_snippets: Reported family history of long QTc syndrome
criterions.criterion: family history of long QTc syndrome

criterions.exact_snippets: QTc of > 450 ms at screening

exclusion_lines.line: 15. A history of prescription drug abuse, or illicit drug use within 9 months prior to screening;

criterions.exact_snippets: A history of prescription drug abuse
illicit drug use within 9 months prior to screening

exclusion_lines.line: 21. Any condition or finding that in the Investigators opinion would put the subject or study conduct at risk if the subject were to participate in the study.

criterions.exact_snippets: Any condition or finding that in the Investigators opinion would put the subject or study conduct at risk if the subject were to participate in the study.

requirements.expected_value: in the Investigator's opinion, would put the subject or study conduct at risk if the subject were to participate

exclusion_lines.line: 4. Reported history of unexplained syncope, symptomatic hypotension or hypoglycemia;

criterions.exact_snippets: Reported history of unexplained syncope
symptomatic hypotension
hypoglycemia

exclusion_lines.line: 18. An unwillingness or inability to comply with food and beverage restrictions during study participation;

criterions.exact_snippets: An unwillingness or inability to comply with food and beverage restrictions during study participation
criterions.criterion: compliance with food and beverage restrictions

criterions.exact_snippets: Poor venous access

exclusion_lines.line: 6. Reported history of chronic diarrhea, malabsorption, unexplained weight loss, food allergies or intolerance;

criterions.exact_snippets: Reported history of chronic diarrhea
Reported history of ... malabsorption
Reported history of ... unexplained weight loss
Reported history of ... food allergies or intolerance

exclusion_lines.line: 13. Taken daily Vitamin A supplement within 3 months prior to screening;

criterions.exact_snippets: Taken daily Vitamin A supplement within 3 months prior to screening

exclusion_lines.line: 19. Use of over-the-counter (OTC) medication within 7 days, and/or herbal medications (including herbal teas, garlic extracts) within 7 days prior to first dose of study drug;

criterions.exact_snippets: Use of over-the-counter (OTC) medication within 7 days ... prior to first dose of study drug
herbal medications (including herbal teas, garlic extracts) within 7 days prior to first dose of study drug

exclusion_lines.line: 10. Taken an investigational drug or participated in a clinical trial within 30 days (or 5 half-lives) prior to first dose of study drug, whichever is longer;

criterions.exact_snippets: Taken an investigational drug ... within 30 days (or 5 half-lives) prior to first dose of study drug, whichever is longer
participated in a clinical trial within 30 days (or 5 half-lives) prior to first dose of study drug, whichever is longer

exclusion_lines.line: 16. A history of alcohol abuse according to medical history (≥ 2 drinks per day for male and ≥ 1 drink per day for female) within 9 months prior to screening;

criterions.exact_snippets: A history of alcohol abuse according to medical history (≥ 2 drinks per day for male and ≥ 1 drink per day for female) within 9 months prior to screening

exclusion_lines.line: 20. Have a history of allergic reactions (either spontaneous or following drug administration) to ATRA or to any of the excipients or related compounds, including vitamin A;

criterions.exact_snippets: history of allergic reactions (either spontaneous or following drug administration) to ATRA
history of allergic reactions (either spontaneous or following drug administration) to ... any of the excipients
history of allergic reactions (either spontaneous or following drug administration) to ... related compounds, including vitamin A
criterions.criterion: allergic reaction to related compounds (including vitamin A)

exclusion_lines.line: 9. Donated or lost >500 mL of blood in the previous 3 months prior to screening;

criterions.exact_snippets: Donated or lost >500 mL of blood in the previous 3 months prior to screening

requirements.expected_value: within the previous 3 months prior to screening

exclusion_lines.line: 17. A positive screen for alcohol, drugs of abuse at screening or admission;

criterions.exact_snippets: A positive screen for alcohol
A positive screen for ... drugs of abuse

exclusion_lines.line: 14. Major surgery or hospitalization within 6 months prior to screening that in the Investigators opinion would put the subject or study conduct at risk;

hospitalization within 6 months prior to screening
that in the Investigators opinion would put the subject or study conduct at risk

requirements.expected_value: would put the subject or study conduct at risk (per Investigator's opinion)
